Title: Apache: multiple buffer overflows
Synopsis:
Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in mod_alias and mod_rewrite can allow
    execution of arbitrary code and cause a denial of service.

Background.Text: The Apache HTTP Server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.

Description.Text: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in mod_alias and mod_rewrite allow attackers who can create or edit configuration files including .htaccess files, to cause a denial of service and execute arbitrary code via a regular expression containing more than 9 captures.

Impact.Text: An attacker may cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user that is running apache.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time, other than to disable both mod_alias and mod_rewrite.

P.Text:
It is recommended that all Gentoo Linux users who are running
    net-misc/apache 1.x upgrade:

Code:
# emerge sync
    # emerge -pv apache
    # emerge '>=www-servers/apache-1.3.29'
    # emerge clean
    # /etc/init.d/apache restart

URI.Text: CAN-2003-0542 (under review at time of GLSA)
